subject: Flickering on brake pedal while haptic motors are running
description_text:
Hello,

First of all I want to add that I used the cable included to ground the
pedals. I tested by attaching it to the box and then to the throttle and
brake pedal with the same results.
I made 2 videos where I tried to explain the best I can what is happening:
 video of brake1.mp4
<https://drive.google.com/file/d/19gmgvNthkZuP5Wjenu9VnAyEsd5w5U_p/view?usp=drive_web>
 video of brake2.mp4
<https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-JiZEy5JmwERFZisK5MpHLHJIlY7gU0T/view?usp=drive_web>
So the issue is as follows, whenever the haptic motor is running (both the
brake and the throttle one) the brake pedal position changes by a few
percent. This is not due to vibration since I tested with it at 10% and and
100% and I got the same result.
It's more visible in the second video I attached where I tried to hold the
brake at 40% and while the haptic motor is running (using the test vibrate
from the software) you can notice the brake pedal spiking to 45-46%. This
is without me changing the pressure.
In the first video it's also visible that without any pressure applied to
the brake when I run the vibration test for the motor there is a pressure
of a few kilograms on the pedal
Is is possible to help on this please as currently I can't run them in game
since it changes my brake a bit too much and it makes it very inconsistent.
This is also a screenshot from telemetry how the brake trace is looking:
[image: image.png]
Thank you!

conversations.body_text: Hi Ghitulescu. andrei,  We recommend installing the VAM Pro using nylon screws and nylon spacers. This helps electrically isolate the VAM Pro from the motor bracket, effectively preventing motor interference with the pedals.

Thanks, I've ordered some and will try.
In the meantime is there something else that I can try or is this the only
option that I have?

And another question, are any of the included screws and spacers nylon or
are they all metal?

On Sun, Jan 4, 2026 at 3:03 AM service@simsonn.com
Hi Ghitulescu. andrei,    Please use a wire to connect a screw on the PC case chassis to a screw on the controller box, and then check whether this improves or resolves the issue.
